title: Old Garratt Steam Train number plate
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Class-GMAM-small_6171.jpg)

This is a number badge/plate for a old GMAM Garratt steam train from South Africa. I need to replace the numbers on the badge with another Garratt's number. Any ideas what the font might be - just for the numbers really.

Thanks in advance!

Font: 

 FF Good Pro Wide Bold 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: Snaphaan

comments.content: Can't find a perfect match. To me, it looks to mixe influences from [DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/din) ( [Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/din+condensed)/ [Engschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/engschrift)) and [Conduit ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/conduit). I like also some URW++ like [Signal](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/font/T1052/signal), [SNV](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/snv) and [Saa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa).

Can't find a perfect match either. You may like **[Good Pro (Wide Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_good_pro_wide_bold/ot_ps/specimen/tester/)** by Lukasz Dziedzic [2010, FSI FontShop International]

Good call, Fivos! **FF Good** family is large with 6 width variations (from Compressed to Extended). You could cover the complete sign with one single family. The only small adjustment you'd need would probably to remove spur on /G.
Good find Fivos, I learned of a font I did not know.
